a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Child mortality vs. health expenditure, 2000 to 2021
Healthcare expenditure per capita is measured in current international-$, which adjusts for price differences
between countries. Under-five mortality is the share of newborns who die before reaching the age of five.
Current health expenditure per capita, PPP
Data source: United Nations Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation (2023); Multiple sources compiled by World Bank (2024)
